newsitem.title: USA: Maine unemployment rate eases to 4.3 pct in Feb..
newsitem.headline: Maine unemployment rate eases to 4.3 pct in Feb..

text.p: Maine's unemployment rate slipped to 4.3 percent in February, off one percentage point from January, mainly due to hirings in the service industry, the state Labor Commissioner said on Monday.
Valerie Landry noted that unemployment has fallen from 5.3 percent over the past year. On a seasonally adjusted basis, nonfarm wage and salary employment rose by 400 in February.
When the data were looked at on a nonseasonally adjusted basis, unemployment rates in Maine counties ranged from 2.9 percent in Cumberland County to 13.0 percent in Washington County.

Nonfarm wage and salary jobs gained 1,900, as state and local governments added 3,800 positions as work-study students and nonpressional staff returned to work after winter vacation breaks. But the retail trade shed 2,200 jobs, a typical seasonal pattern, while construction employment fell by 1,100 due to winter weather.
